moves.10... Bxc5 11. dxc5 Nbd7: Black emerges down a piece for a Pawn.
I have to be careful. My Q side pieces are a bit exposed.
moves.17... Qc6 18. Nc3 h6 19. Bb5: My position is now more secure and allows me to be a bit aggressive.
moves.19... Qc7 20. Qd4 e5 21. Nxd5: I offer an exchange of Queens...
moves.22. Nxf6+: May as well swap down. It accentuates my material advantage.
moves.22... gxf6 23. Qd2 Rd8 24. Rfd1: Opposing Rooks on the Q file.
moves.24... Qc7 25. Qd6: I offer an exchange of Queens yet again...
moves.25... Qxd6: ...and this time, the offer is accepted.
moves.26. Rxd6 Ba6 27. Bxa6: If Black wants to exchange pieces, I'm all for it.
moves.28... e4 29. Nh4 Ra7: Black's pieces are now essentially fixed.
I'm struggling to form a good plan.
moves.33... Ne5 34. Rd6d2 Kg6 35. Ng3 Rc7c4 36: Black has gained considerable freedom of movement.
moves.37. Ne2 f5 38. Nf4+: I force the removal of the Knights.
I'm not going to trade Rooks until I can do it on my own terms and not have Black recapture with a check.
moves.44... Rxc1 45. Rd2: Not letting Black's Rook on the 8th rank have a target.
moves.45... Kg5 46. Kg3 h4+ 47. Kh2: Now my Pawns are keeping the King at bay.
moves.50. Rd2 f5 51. Rb2 Re1 52. Rxb5: A mistake. The Rook should not have left the second rank.
moves.52... Re2 53. Rb1 Rxf2 54. Rg1: Now I'm thrown onto the defensive.
moves.54... Rc2 55. Bd4 f4: Black can have the QRP if he wants it. That would let my Rook get back on the second rank.
moves.58. gxf3: I was expecting PxP in reply.
moves.59... Re1 60. Kg2: Black's advanced P will fall. Black resigns.
